required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Biomarkers to Detect Anal Intraepithelial Neoplasia in Thai Men Who Have Sex With Men
clinical_study.official_title: The Thai Red Cross AIDS Research Centre

lead_sponsor.agency: Thai Red Cross AIDS Research Centre

collaborator.agency: South East Asia Research Collaboration with Hawaii

clinical_study.source: Thai Red Cross AIDS Research Centre

brief_summary.textblock: The goals of this application are to assess the usefulness of biomarkers, including p16 proteins, minichromosome maintenance (MCM) proteins, high-risk human papillomavirus (HPV) types, and E6 and E7 mRNA/oncoproteins, as adjunct tools to anal Pap smear in identifying HGAIN and to study the impact of HIV infection on the characteristics of anal cytology (by anal Pap smear) and biomarkers. To fulfill these goals, in addition to routine practice, it will be necessary to follow 450 MSM (315 HIV-positives and 135 HIV-negatives) over 60 months, and perform HRA and biomarkers on all clients at baseline and every 12 months. Information from this study would inform AIN screening and follow up approaches in HIV-positive and HIV-negative MSM in both resource-limited and resource-rich settings.

detailed_description.textblock: The goals of this application are to assess the usefulness of biomarkers, including p16 proteins, MCM proteins, high-risk HPV types, and E6 and E7 mRNA/oncoproteins, as adjunct tools to anal Pap smear in identifying HGAIN and to study the impact of HIV infection on the characteristics of anal cytology (by anal Pap smear) and biomarkers. To fulfill these goals, in addition to routine practice, it will be necessary to follow 450 MSM (315 HIV-positives and 135 HIV-negatives) over 60 months, and perform HRA and biomarkers on all clients at baseline and every 12 months. Information from this study would inform AIN screening and follow up approaches in HIV-positive and HIV-negative MSM in both resource-limited and resource-rich settings.

study_pop.textblock: MSM with HIV negative and positive in Thailand

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- MSM with HIV negative
- MSM with HIV positive

clinical_study.keyword: likelihood of AIN development at month 12 and yearly thereafter
